During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Miriam’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Nally

texts.en: Nally is 43 years old and lives in Montserrado County, in the capital city of Liberia; it is well known as the commercial city  of Liberia. She is married and has two children, ages 11 and 15, and both of them are presently attending school. For the past five years Nally has been selling rice by the cup on a table in the local market. Her major problem is that the price of  rice is very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business. She plans to live a better life and get a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be social and a talkative woman. She operates a tailoring store where she sells clothes she makes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Tabitha will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric. Her business goal is to improve her business and employ people on her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 31-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be a quiet man. He operates a retail business where he sells mirrors and calendars. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located along a busy street opposite a potential shopping mall and his primary customers are businesspeople and the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Simon will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy calendars and mirrors to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within fivd years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. In addition, Simon does farming which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy more calendars and mirrors to sell

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Rachael lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, four of whom are in school. She sells green bananas at the market on both a retail only and wholesale basis. She has no additional family members. Rachael has been in business for the last six years. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges are defaulters, transportation, and seasonality. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. She hopes to start selling on a wholesale only basis and wants to own a delivery van to ease her transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of  bananas

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is a 42-year-old man. He describes himself to be ambitious and an optimistic man. He operates a butcher shop  where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. His primary customers are local butcheries, restaurants and farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate meat for selling. 

Clement will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy goats to slaughter for meat. His business goal is to be a large-scale distributor of meat within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more goats to slaughter for meat

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy  is married with eight children, and five of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has business of poultry farming and has been in this   business for eight years, selling to all categories of people but wholesale only, six days a week.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more  bags of chicken feed.

 She generates additional income from selling motor vehicle scrap. She works at the market .Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring   of owning a delivery van to ease transportation and also buying a plot of land and building rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en:
Yah lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, well-known as a commercial centre. A 45-year-old married mother of four children between 20 and 29 years of age, two of whom live at home, for the past four years Yah has been selling charcoal in the local market. Having learned this method of selling from her mother, she started the business with a little money from her husband.

Yah is requesting this loan to purchase more charcoal for her business, and plans to educate all of her children and eventually own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 51-year-old married woman. She has nine children with ages ranging from 7 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and an optimistic woman. She operates a grocery store and retail business where she sells vegetables, fruit and baskets. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a rural area and her primary customers are the general public from the environs. 

Florence describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy cabbages and tomatoes for resale. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cabbages and tomatoes to sell in her grocery store business

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 35-year-old, married man. He has two children, six years and ten years old. He describes himself to be a social and talkative man. 

Andrew operates a retail shop where he sells electronics, such as phone accessories, spare parts, cell phone chargers, and cell phones. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Andrew will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy mobile phone accessories. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children. This is Andrew's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). In addition, Andrew does farming, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories for his shop.

loans.name: Etendard 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Milose est la coordonatrice de son groupe ETENDARD DE OUANAMINTHE Milose habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Milose a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années.

Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle etait a l’ecole. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du produits alimentaires. Milose espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les autres membres Etendard ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses. Milose dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness.
texts.en:
Milose is the coordinator of her group "ETENDARD DE OUANAMINTHE".  She lives in Haiti, in the city of OUANAMINTHE, where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited.  She has been managing her own business for the past seven years. Before getting involved in this commercial activity, she was in school. 

Milose would like to use her loan to invest in the purchase of food products.  She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

The other members of the ETENDARD group need a loan to finance retail activities such as the sale of charcoal, rice, and used clothes.

Milose says that her main challenge is a constant lack of buyers.  Her main goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Cerapio

texts.en:
Cerapio is a master weaver from Peru who specializes in the Ayacucho style of tapestries. He would like to invest in the purchase of wool yarn and cotton thread to increase production.

Cerapio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was forced to leave my home in Ayacucho during the 1980s. Terrorists were bleeding my people to death and there seemed little hope. I inherited my passion for weaving from my parents and grandparents. But the quality of my work is the result of my long experience, and the product of my careful observation over the years. I draw inspiration from our ancient Peruvian cultures, Andean village life, and our snow-capped mountains.'

"Thanks to your support, I've grown as an artist, not only through sales, but also by developing many more designs. I thank you for your support with this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Cerapio's wool rugs and tapestries on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/194

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wool yarn and cotton thread to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase computers and to hire a new employee for her law office.

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada, tiene dos hijas que estudian en la universidad y dependen de ella económicamente, administra una pupuseria en la que trabaja de  Martes a Domingo, por las tardes, sus hijas le ayudan en el negocio, su experiencia es de cinco años.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, una plancha para hacer pupusas nueva, gas, esto le ayudara a que incremente la posibilidad de generar más ingresos, aumentando su venta.  
Su objetivo es con el préstamo fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecer una mejor condición de vida con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Fifty-three year old Rosa is married.  She has two daughters, both of whom are studying at university and who depend on Rosa financially.  Rosa makes and sells stuffed tortillas.  She works in the afternoons from Tuesday through to Sunday and her daughters help with the business.  She has five years experience.

She is applying for a loan to buy tables, gas and a new grill for making the stuffed tortillas.  The loan will help Rosa possibly to increase her income, by increasing her sales.

Her aim is to use the loan to strengthen her business and, with her work, offer better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tables, gas and a new grill for making stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has one child, who goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). Milly has operated a clinic for 5 years. She works from her home seven days every week on a retail basis only. Milly's major business challenges are defaulters, seasonality, thieves and the ever increasing prices of medicines in Uganda.

Milly has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of drugs, syringes and syrups. She hopes to own a fully stocked clinic or drug shop and to upgrade her clinic to a hospital. Milly resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more drugs, syringes and syrups

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu, 45 years old, lives in Montserrado County in the capital city of Liberia, well known as a commercial city. She is married and has five children aged between 17 and 20 years old, all in school and living at home. For the past eight years, Musu has been selling charcoal in her community. She started this business with her father's help and learned this way of selling from him. Musu likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Musu's dream is to get  money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is a wood-carver from Guatemala. Diego would like to stock up on raw materials for his hand-carved sculptures and masks and also buy an electric jigsaw. Diego has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I am a Maya woodcarver. At age 10, I left school to help my father work in the fields. Eventually, I began selling wooden masks, then learned to carve and paint them, while still helping my father. I am a devout Catholic, so I then began carving images of saints. Today, I have taught my art to six people, and I have been able to put my children, who are also wood carvers, through school.

"I'm very grateful to you because you're helping me a lot. Sometimes, I don't sell much, so this money helps me to continue working and producing. The micro-credit last year was a huge help, as you gave me a hand at a time when things were really tough for me. I want to buy an electric jigsaw, which will help me work faster and improve my quality because, at the moment, we do the cutting with a machete."

Use the link below to view Diego's wood sculptures and masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7299

loans.use: to stock up on raw materials for his hand-carved sculptures and masks and also to buy an electric jigsaw.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silver and natural gemstones.

Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"Jewelry is my life. It impassions me. Each design is like a child to me. My artistic formation began when I was 12, when my older sister married an experienced silversmith. I was an apprentice at his workshop, and then became a master silversmith, too. I love the thrill of working on new designs."

"Thanks to you and your collaboration in this microcredit, I'll be able to create more designs and thus increase my production, which is inspired by nature, as always!"

Use the link below to view Victor's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7269

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silver and natural gemstones

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine, 56 years old, is married and has 7 children whose ages range from 16 to 36 years old. She describes herself as a social woman. For the past 3 years, Josphine has operated a retail business weaving and selling baskets. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. Josphine describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of weaving materials. She will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy weaving materials for making more baskets to sell. Josphine's business goal is to expand her business and employ many people within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have improved her business. This is Josphine's first loan with SMEP DTM. She also farms to increase her business income.

loans.use: to buy basket weaving materials for making more baskets to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wooden masks and sculptures as well as in leather items. He would like to invest in the purchase of more local woods, polish, sandpaper and glue.

Francis has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I come from a family of traditional wood carvers. While at school, funding was becoming difficult, so during weekends and vacations, I would visit my father's workshop and assist him by carving some products for sale. The realization eventually dawned on me to stay on, work on my own designs, and display my own woodcarvings. I opened a new workshop, which my sister and a cousin manage, and together we preserve the family legacy." 

"Thank you so much for taking part in this microcredit, because it will help me increase my stock. I pray that you keep on doing what you're doing to be able to support artisans like me."

Use the link below to view Francis's wood masks and leather desk sets on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3835

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more local woods, polish, sandpaper and glue

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is an artisan in Ghana who specializes in carving traditional masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of more local wood and polish.

Wilson has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I became interested in Ghanaian African carvings when I was a child, so after middle school I learned the trade through a man named Mr. Akoffour. Now I have my own workshop and am training three people. I carve different types of masks and each of them has a meaning. My products are unique and my goal is to create more."

"I thank you all for contributing to this microcredit. It will help me keep in business doing what I love."

Use the link below to view Wilson's African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4507

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more local wood and polish

loans.name: Abdeljabbar

texts.en:
AbdelJabbar is a 26-year-old single young man. He lives a simple life with his family in Jenin. He is employed and gets a low salary which is barely enough to cover his needs.

AbdelJabbar is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new refrigerator for his family to use at home. Taking this loan will offer AbdelJabbar and his family better living conditions. AbdelJabbar is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for home-use.

loans.name: Osaima

texts.en:
Osaima is a 26-year-old married young woman from Jenin. She is mother to two daughters. Osaima's husband is a worker who makes a very low wage, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
 
For the past four years, Osaima has had a shoe store in a good location in Jinen city. She has a lot of loyal customers. Osaima would like to improve the family income by buying more products for her store.
 
Osaima requested a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN. This will allow Osaima to offer a better selection for her customers to buy, which will improve the family's income.

In the photo, Osaima appears in her store.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of shoes to sell

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leónidas, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita dinero para invertir en la siembra de granos básicos, con este dinero pagara el alquiler de tres manzanas de terreno para realizar la nueva siembra, tambien la mano de obra para sacar la cosecha anterior.
El efecto que le tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue un cultivo bastante productivo, del cual ha sacado cosecha para la alimentación de su familia, él considera que se ha mantenido en las condiciones adecuadas, su trabajo con Kiva le ha sido de provecho.
texts.en:
Leónidas decided in favor of a new loan because he needs the money to invest in planting staple foods.  With this money, he will pay the rent on three blocks of land for the new planting, and also for the labor to gather the previous harvest.

The effect of the previous loan was quite a productive crop, from which he has gotten a harvest to feed his family.  He feels he has adequately supported himself, and that his work with Kiva has been beneficial to him.

loans.use: to pay the rent on 3 blocks of land and for labor.

loans.name: Bahaa Eddin

texts.en:
Bahaa Eddin is a 21-year-old single young man from a village near Nablus called Tubas. Bahaa has worked as a carpenter for one year. He has his own business which is located in a good place in Tubas and his handmade products are known as good quality products. To improve the business Bahaa would like to buy a new cutting wood machine to provide even better quality to his loyal customers.

Bahaa would like to request a 2000 USD Youth loan from FATEN. This will allow Bahaa to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase his income.

In the photo, Bahaa appears in his carpentry shop.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for his carpentry

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
After a car accident, Vangie’s insurance company claimed her car was a complete loss and issued funds to replace it. Agreeing to repurchase her car and repair its front suspension per her husband’s suggestion, Vangie was informed her vehicle was up for auction and she would have to bid for it. 

Vangie returned with three vehicles from the auction, none of which were her original. She then hired a mechanic to repair them before selling them. The vehicles sold quicker than Vangie expected, so she then decided to continue purchasing vehicles from auctions, creating a new career for herself.

It’s been 15 years since Vangie’s first sale. She now carries 40 to 50 trucks, cars, SUVs, vans, blue title and salvaged-titled cars purchased from auctions at her buy-here-pay-here lot, A & V Auto Sales, located in her hometown of San Antonio.

Compared to the multiple car lots in San Antonio and its surrounding cities, Vangie says her car lot is different because, “We try to work with everybody, and if they have problems with their cars after the purchase, we’ll go the extra mile to fix it. If I have the parts, I’ll give them to you, just pay for the labor.”

Vangie has always been an entrepreneur. Her passion to sell began as a child selling various items at yard sales with her mom. As she grew older, Vangie made seasonal trips to Mexico to purchase wrought iron presents to sell in the U.S.A. and earn a small profit during the Christmas season.

Currently, Vangie employs two office workers, a salesman and a mechanic. She plans to hire at least one more mechanic in the near future.

Once a friend and former Accion Texas Inc. client suggested she inquire about a loan from Accion, she did. Since approved, Vangie says she is able to make ten more payments on her purchased cars. She is also able to purchase more cars before tax season, which is a high vehicle-selling season. She plans to use the rest of her loan for working capital. 

Though she has a successful business, being a used-car salesperson doesn’t automatically guarantee an easy business path. Vangie understands how she has to switch gears when dealing with disgruntled clients. Within her 15 years of service, she says she’s grateful to only have had two unsatisfied clients. 

“I just want to try to sell good cars to people and not have these negative problems,” she says. “I try hard to sell a good car. It’s not in my interest to sell a bad car; I’m not like that. If I feel a car is in bad terms, I’ll fix it. I get under the cars if I have to, and if I hit the wall, I’ll give it to the mechanic.”

loans.use: to make multiple payments on her cars and pay for working capital.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai, 30 years old, is married and the father of one son. He lives with his family in a small village near Jenin called Om Al-Reehan, famous for planting olive and wheat.

For the past three years, Odai has been driving a taxi in addition to his work in agriculture. It has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover some necessary costs. Odai is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of licensing and insuring his taxi. This will enable Odai to work extra hours and to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively. Odai is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To insure and license his taxi

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alberto ya ha un crédito con KIVA el cual fue para el mejoramiento de su vivienda con ese préstamo pudo construir dos cuartos. 
Esta solicitando un crédito para la colocación de la losa de concreto que le esta haciendo falta para terminar las recamaras de sus dos hijos ya que están creciendo y necesitan su propio espacio en la casa.
Con una parte del sueldo que gana como soldador de un taller de herrería es para pagar el crédito.
Desea mejor el patrimonio de su familia y que sus hijos tengan si propio espacio y privacidad en la casa.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto has had Kiva loans in the past, which he used to make improvements to his home and was able to build two rooms.
He is requesting a loan to install concrete floors, that he needs to finish the two bedrooms for his children, who are growing and need their own space at home.  Part of the salary that he earns as a welder in an iron shop will be used to pay for the loan.  He wishes to improve his family's patrimony and that his children have their own space and privacy at home.

loans.use: to install concrete floors in two bedrooms.

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en:
Hikmat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her sister's son Jihad appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Hikmat is a 49-year-old married woman and mother to two sons and one daughter. All are school students.

For the past two years, Hikmat has had a fruit and vegetable stall, selling different types of seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has a good reputation among her customers, which makes her business a profitable one. It is the only source of incomer for her family who needs more support to cover their expenses.

Hikmat is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing seasonal fruits that customers request and buy. Taking this loan will help Hikmat meet her customers demand and increase her sales, which will increase her income and create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas, 40 years old, is married and the father of three sons and one daughter. Firas is a painter who has a good reputation among his customers because of his high quality work. He does big jobs and earns a good income.

Firas wants to empower and improve his work, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to purchase a wide variety of paints. This will enable Firas to complete his work and satisfy his customers, which will help to improve his income positively and to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of paints

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en: Thaer is a 24-year-old single man from Tulkarem. He works in a local chocolate factory and gets a good salary which helps him cover some of his needs. Thaer is also a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him to do his homework and reports and help him in both his studies and his work. This will ensure a better future for Thaer and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, se decidió por continuar trabajando en el negocio de la venta de tortillas, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz por mayoreo, para obtener un mejor precio y poder continuar trabajando.

Ella considera que con la ayuda del crédito anterior, logro mejorar el bienestar en la familia, su fuente de ingresos para la subsistencia han sido mejor, su aspiración es continuar trabajando, pues comenta que sus ventas han sido más abundantes.
texts.en:
Rosa has made up her mind to continue working in the business of selling tortillas, for that reason she is seeking a new loan to invest in the purchase of corn, wholesale, to get a better price and to be able to continue working. 

She believes that with the help of her previous loan, she was able to improve the well-being of her family, and her source of income for her livelihood has been better. She aspires to continue working, since she comments that her sales have been more abundant.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Asociacion De Mujeres Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana Gregoria esta casad, tiene 40 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, a la confección de blusas típicas, inicio este negocio siendo trabajadora con una amiga y con su propio negocio lo inicio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 22 años de experiencia,cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos, esto para incrementar su producción y tener un negocio amplio, con mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican también a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Juana Gregoria is married; she's 40-years-old.  She completed 4 years of primary education.  She has 5 children, 3 of whom are studying.  She works as an artisan making traditional blouses.  She started her business with her friend and the little capital they had, and they now have 22 years of experience.  She also has the support of her husband who is a bricklayer.  

She has organized a group and is requesting a loan for the purchase of thread in order to increase production and increase her income.  The other members of the group are also artisans.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel started business in 2005 with hardships due to limited capital, which affected his operations. Due to the challenges he incurred, he decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited - Rukungiri branch for financial assistance, so as to expand his business' daily operations.

The loans he has obtained from the institution over time have enabled him to expand his business and serve more customers in distant areas. Therefore, UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) has enabled Daniel to expand his business,build his residential house, pay school dues for his children, and support other family members.He will use this particular loan to complete his residential house.

loans.use: To complete his residential house.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is 35 years old, married, with three children, two of whom are school-going. He is involved in agricultural trade, mainly beans, ground nuts, and irish potatoes, which he buys from farmers in the villages and takes to the market. Asaph started this business in 2009 to have a wide source of income to support his family and he always supplies the residents of Kagadi town.

Asaph wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Uganda shillings) to add to his agricultural trade business, so that he can realize good returns out of this trade. Asaph is challenged by the changing weather conditions that affect agricultural production, plus the poor transport network. 

His dream is to buy a vehicle to transport the produce goods to the market as well as educating his children, using the proceeds from the business. Asaph would like the lender to avail him with funds in future to buy a vehicle that will help to ease transportation of his goods.

loans.use: To buy beans and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Rosebell

texts.en:
Rosebell is a 35-year-old woman dealing in Agricultural Commodities, particularly the coffee trade. The coffee-trading business is dominated by men, but she stood out from the crowd and joined it. She has done the business for the past five years and has gained good experience from it.

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to purchase coffee from farmers. She harvests some of it from her garden, and also buys from farmers.

She has managed to supplement the income of her household, and also has contributed to her children's tuition. Rosebell confesses that her husband is proud of her, because she is hard-working.

loans.use: to purchase coffee for her coffee-trading business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 35 years old and married with six children. Four of his children go to school. William has a motorcycle, which he uses to earn income for sustaining his family. On top of that, he is also a farmer from which he earns additional incomes to support his family.

William wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy a new motorcycle to add to the one he has currently and to increase his earnings. He always faces the business challenges of weather changes, most especially when it rains heavily and the roads are impassable, as well as competition in the business.

William's dream is to have many motorcycles so that he can realize good returns from his business, which will enable him to start up a permanent income-generating project for his wife and therefore provide adequately for his family.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Manuel Aparicio

texts.es:
Manuel, necesita dinero para invertir en el cultivo de granos básicos, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra, que son los necesarios para realizar su trabajo.
Con el préstamo anterior él considera que la producción en el cultivo estuvo bien, esto le sirvió para vender y de sus ganancias cubrir otras necesidades en el hogar, con la inversión del crédito Kiva, ha mejorado su condición en la familia y tambien como agricultor, se encuentra muy bien de salud y mantiene su número familiar.
texts.en:
Manuel needs money in order to grow basic grains. That's why he requests a new loan so that he can purchase supplies such as compost and herbicides, as well as pay for the labor. Those are the things he needs in order to do his work.
He believes that with the previous loan, the level of production in his crop went well. This helped him to sell and to afford other household necessities with his profits. By using his Kiva loan he has improved his stance as a family man and also as a farmer. He currently enjoys very good health and maintains the same number of family members.

loans.use: to purchase compost and herbicides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Xiomara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Xiomara, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de un año de edad, el negocio lo realiza para cubrir gastos del bebe y de ella, tiene tres años de realizar la venta, lo inicio por una amiga.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y gas propano, que son los insumos para realizar la venta, muy necesarios en el día a día, este préstamo le dará el recurso financiero con el cual podrá seguir trabajando. 
La aspiración de Xiomara es mantener a su hijo y darle una vida mejor, ya que es madre soltera, necesita ir mejorando sus condiciones económicas,
texts.en:
Xiomara is a 32-year old woman and single mother of a 1-year old boy. She works selling "tortillas" (thin corn pancakes), a business that she started 3 years ago thanks to a friend, and that allows her to cover the expenses of herself and the baby. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood and propane gas, which are the necessary inputs for her business on a day-to-day basis. This loan will give her the financial support she needs to continue working. 

Xiomara's biggest dream is to support her son and to provide him with a better life. Given that she is a single mother, she needs to keep improving her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and propane gas.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Mujeres Responsables está conformado por 9 integrantes 8 mujeres, Y un  hombres, todos mayores de edad, casados con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estos integrantes son originarios del departamento de  Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de Leche. Célica es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del pago de los integrantes.  Célica tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía como adornos de barro, ollas, comal, jícaras, adornos de cocina de sala. Fruteras, alcancillas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de artesanía. La rutina de Célica es trabajar unas 8 horas de diaria de forma ambulantes ofreciendo su producto en las diferentes comunidades. El banco comunal Mujeres responsables agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Responsable communal bank is made up of nine members.  Eight of them are women, and one is a man.  They are all adults, married, and are responsible for their children.  These members are from the Sauce department.  This place is located in the northern part of the country.  El Sauce is known for being a milk producing area.

Célica is the coordinator of the communal bank.  She has the responsibility of being in charge of the members’ payment.  Célica sells crafts like clay decorations, pots, griddles, gourds, kitchen and living rooms decorations, fruit dishes, and piggy banks.

The objective of the loan is to invest working capital and to stock her business of buying and selling crafts.  Célica's routine is to work eight hours a day.  She works in an itinerant manner, offering her product in the different communities.

The Mujeres Responsables communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have a decent way of working.

loans.use: to stock her business with crafts like clay decorations, pots, griddles, gourds, kitchen and living rooms decorations, fruit dishes, and piggy banks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene 41 años. Es un hombre soltero y sin hijos. El comenzó con su negocio cuando aprendió a estampar camisas, las mismas que las vendía a las personas que asistían a la Iglesia con él. Poco a poco crecieron sus ventas y comenzó a vender las camisas que el estampaba a otras personas del sector y a Instituciones. 

En la actualidad sigue con su negocio de camisas estampadas pero una de sus dificultades es su enfermedad es PVVS (paciente viviendo con VIH sida), ya que al estampar las camisas el olor de la pintura lo debilita, ya que por su enfermedad esta propenso a que sus defensas bajen. Por eso su trabajo lo realiza desde las 12:00 hasta las 18:00. 

Marcos tiene muchas ganas de seguir con su negocio por eso el quiere comprar con el prestamo camisas para estampar, pinturas, moldes. 

Las palabras del cliente en la visita fueron: 

Yo espero seguir teniendo la ayuda y bendicion de Dios para poder continuar adelante a pesar de su salud y asi tener un taller formal y poder dar trabajo a mis amigos y compañeros que estan pasando por lo mismo que yo, yo se que si se puede seguir adelante, y siempre hay que confiar que hay un mañana, hay una esperanza, para poder disfrutar un dia mas con mi familia.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 41, lives in Guayaquil. He is a single man and has no children. He started with his business when he learned how to stamp shirts.  He sold them to the people who went to the same church that he did.  Little by little, his sales grew, and he started to sell the shirts that he stamped to people in other areas and institutions.

He currently continues with his business of stamping shirts.  However, one of his difficulties is that his illness is PVVS (patient living with HIV/AIDS).  The odor from the paint when stamping the shirts weakens him, since his illness causes his defenses to go down.  He works from 12:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m.

Marcos has a great desire to continue with his business.  He wants to use the loan to buy shirts to stamp, paints, and stamping blocks.  

His words were:
"I hope to continue having God's help and blessing to be able to continue moving forward in spite of my health, and in this way have a formal workshop and give work to my friends and colleagues who are in the same situation as I am. I know that if I can continue moving forward - and one always must believe in a tomorrow - that there is hope to be able to enjoy one more day with my family."

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, paint, and stamping blocks.

loans.name: Dolores Alejandra

texts.es: Dolores Alejandra, a sus 50 años de edad, acompañada con cinco hijos de 24,26,28,30 y 31 años de edad todos trabajan, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general como: bolsos, ropa, zapatos, prenda, sabanas, candelas, perfumenes, sandalias, blusas, entre otros. Dolores Tiene 32 años de tener esta negocio.  Ella vende al por mayor y al menor, además trae productos comestibles de honduras y también lleva cosméticos a ese país, ella realiza esta actividad de manera ambulante, ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como  sabanas, calzado, perfumes, ropa interior, bolsos, prendas y otros productos. Dolores está muy agradecida con  la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Dolores Alejandra is fifty years old and is accompanied by five children, ages 24, 26, 28, 30, and 31.  All of her children work.  She makes a living in the buying and selling of general merchandise, like purses, clothing, shoes, clothing items, sheets, candles, perfumes, sandals, blouses, and other items.  Dolores has had this business for thirty-two years.  She sells by the item and wholesale.  She also brings in edible products from Honduras, and additionally carries cosmetics to that country.  She does her business in selling door-to-door. 

She is requesting this loan to buy basic items, like sheets, shoes, perfumes, underwear, purses, clothing items, and other products.  Dolores is very thankful for the help of the loaners at Kiva, who offer people with scarce resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua, to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to supply her business with perfumes, body creams, cosmetics, children's clothing, pants, shirts, skirts, underwear, purses, candles, edible items, and others products.

loans.name: Flora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Flora del Carmen  de 65 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo mayor de edad de 29 anos, vive en la ciudad de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona sur de león. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables, lo cual lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores en cuanto a la responsabilidad de sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado ser una enfermera titulada.
 Gracias a su espíritu  y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos a los comerciantes de la localidad. La cual lo utiliza para elaborar comidas típicas de la región. La rutina de esta mujer es salir a las comunidades aledañas a comprar cerdos al mejor precio para la futura venta. Y que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta, ya que se lo están dando a buen precio.	Flora del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Flora del Carmen is 65 years old. She is a single mother with one son who is 29 years old. She lives in the city of Managua, which is located south of León. She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman, which she has demonstrated in her previous loans by making her payments responsibly, on time and according to their terms. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, she was unable to pursue a university degree, but she would have liked to have been a registered nurse.

Thanks to her spirit and her will to carry on, she has a business raising and selling pigs to merchants in her area, who use them to prepare typical regional foods. Her routine is to go out to the neighboring communities to buy pigs at the best prices for future sale, in hopes of making better money in the not-too-distant future. The objective of this loan is to serve as working capital to buy a drove of pigs to raise and sell, since she is being offered a good price. 

Flora del Carmen is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to disadvantaged people in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they might have a decent way to earn a living.

loans.use: to have working capital for her business buying and selling pigs in the neighboring communities.

loans.name: Jose Arquimides

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita dinero para invertir en el cultivo de granos básicos, primero pagara el alquiler de terreno y comprara insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas, que son necesarios para desarrollar este oficio.
Él manifiesta que el aporte del préstamo anterior lo utilizo para los materiales de la agricultura, con su trabajo está cubriendo las necesidades en su familia, no ha aumentado sus miembros, gracias al crédito Kiva se encuentra trabajando.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan because he needs money to invest in growing basic grains.  First he will rent the plot of land and then he will buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides, which are needed for this type of operation.

José used his previous loan to buy agricultural materials, and with his agricultural work he is paying for the needs of his family, which has not increased in size.  He says that it is thanks to his Kiva loan that he is working.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land and to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and pay staff for his home renovation business.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is 30 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. Vahe is unmarried and lives with his parents. His brother now lives and works in the Russian Federation and often helps his family in Vanadzor by sharing their family expenses. 
Vahe used to be a worker in Vanadzor's factories. Now he works as a welder. He has been working as a welder for about five years. He makes iron gates, grilles and the like to order. 
He learned welding from his father, who has much experience in this specialized work. Vahe now has lots of clients and many orders in Vanadzor and nearby villages, and he has a good in the Lori region for his work. 
Vahe has applied for a loan of AMD 120,000 to buy liquefied gas, oxygen cylinders and other suppliers for his welding.

loans.use: To buy liquefied gas, oxygen cylinders and other supplies for his work as a welder.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque tiene que realizar la siembra de granos básicos para la temporada,  con este dinero comprara insumos agrícolas como abono y herbicidas, además arrendara dos manzanas de terreno.
Con el préstamo anterior aumento su capacidad en el cultivo, que le ha servido para obtener ingresos y comprar lo más necesario a su familia, sus condiciones en la familia están siendo más favorables, gracias al aporte a través de kiva.
texts.en:
Miguel has decided to get a new loan because he has to sow basic grains for the upcoming season. With the money he'll purchase supplies such as compost and herbicides. In addition, he'll also rent two manzanas (about 3.47 acres) of land.
With the previous loan he expanded his crop, which helped him to turn a profit and buy the things his family needed the most. His family's conditions have been improving thanks to the loan he obtained through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses and underwear for both sexes

loans.name: Melis Marisa

texts.es:
Melis, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos con su esposo, quienes están estudiando, ella realiza el negocio de la venta de tortillas, las realiza en su casa de lunes a sábado, lo aprendió de su madre quien tambien vende tortillas.
Melis está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de Tortillas, como lo es el maíz, leña, cal, un comal en el que se cosen las tortillas, esto le ayudara a mantener lo necesario y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
El objetivo de ella es que el negocio este fortalecido, atender a mucha clientela de la cual pueda obtener los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Melis is a tortilla vendor. She is 37 years old, married, and she and her husband have three children who are currently studying. She manages her tortilla selling business, working at it Monday through Saturday. She learned this trade from her mother who also works selling tortillas. 
Melis is requesting a loan in order to purchase the necessary materials for making tortillas: corn, wood, lime, and a griddle for cooking. These items will help her maintain her business and improve her earnings. Her goal is to have a well-established business and serve more customers in order to obtain greater earnings and thereby help her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, lime, and a griddle.

loans.name: Sidi's Group

texts.en: Sidi is a 58-year-old farmer and mother of seven. She has been growing maize and keeping chickens to support her children after her husband's death, and currently sends three of them to school. Sidi's businesses face the challenges of drought and price fluctuations. She has joined the KOMAZA tree farm program so she can earn money for her family's needs and send the children to school.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Deborah De Samarie 1, 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Erno a dirigé son commerce de Produits divers pendant les 4 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le commerce. Il va acheter des objets divers tels que des chaussures, des vêtements, des produits cosmétiques.

Erno a eu de bonnes ventes.  cette demande pour un autre financement pour accroître son inventaire avec d'autres membres du Deborah de Samarie. Il s'attend entreprise de continuer à faire croître leur entreprise et en ajoutant plus de produits.
texts.en:
Erno managed his business selling various products during the past 4 years. He would like to use this loan to invest in his business. He is going to buy various products such as shoes, clothing and cosmetic products.

Erno has had good sales.  This is request for another loan to grow his inventory with other members of Deborah de Samarie. He plans to continue to grow his business and to add more products.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Les Anges De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Gerard est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Anges de Ouanaminthe. Il est marié et il a 4 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il a dirigé son commerce pendant les dernières 6 années. 

Gerard voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans la vente de chaussures de sport et vetement. Gerard espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de sont groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon, les produits divers, et cosmetologie. Gerard dit que ses défi principal sont les manques d,achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit. Gerard dit que son but principal pour obtenir un plus grand commerce et satisfaire davantage de clients avec l`aide de DIEU.
texts.en:
Gerard is the coordinator of his group "Les Anges de Ouanaminthe".  He is married and has four children.  He lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited.  He has been managing his own business for the past six years.

Gerard would like to use his loan to invest in the sale of athletic shoes and clothing.  He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his commercial activity.  The other members of the group need a loan to finance such retail activities as the sale of charcoal, cosmetic products and other various goods.

According to Gerard, his main challenge is a lack of buyers.  Too many people also want to buy on credit.  His main goal is to expand his business and to meet the needs of a larger group of customers, with God's help.

loans.use: to buy athletic shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy things like corn, firewood, gas, bags, and lime powder to make tortillas.

loans.name: San Fernando Ii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Fernando está conformado por 9 integrantes, madres solteras, con 16 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Y se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, cuajada, queso. Lamentablemente estas mujeres no han podido estudiar, por falta de recursos económico, por lo tanto ellas desean un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante,  Modesta Aurora tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada de forma ambulante, y en su casa de habitación. la rutina de esta mujer es trabajar una 8 horas diarias bajo el intenso sol, cargando una pana de cuajada en su cabeza de unos 20 kg. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto porque ha sido su forma de vida y la de sus hijos. El banco comunal San Fernando agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The San Fernando Community Bank is comprised of nine members, all single mothers, with a total of 16 children to care for between them. They are each from El Sauce, a town in the northern part of the country. The region is known for its milk, cheese, and curd production.

Unfortunately these women have not had the opportunity to study due to a lack of economic resources, but they each desire a better future for their children. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and desire to succeed, Modesta Aurora has a job selling cuajada as a street vendor and from her home. Her routine is to work eight hours a day under the hot sun, carrying a 20 kg (roughly 45 lbs) basket of cuajada on her head. She carries out this duty with pleasure as it is her way of making a living for herself and her children. 

The San Fernando Community Bank appreciates the assistance that Kiva donors offer to persons of limited resources and impoverished countries such as Nicaragua so that people may obtain dignified employment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock their business buying and selling cuajada (cheese curd) for retail sale as street vendors.

loans.name: Phyroth's Group

texts.en: Phyroth is an elderly man of 50. He is married and has four daughters, all of whom are currently going to school. He and his family live in a rural village of the Sa Ang district in Cambodia's Kandal province. Phyroth is in an agricultural business, farming rice on 3.5 hectares of farmland. Having been in the rice-growing business for more than 20 years, he is able to earn around 10,000 KHR per day and save approximately 4,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. Phyroth is leading a loan group of five members, who are all first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner; all them are taking out loans in amount of 160,000 KHR each. As a group representative, Phyroth will utilize his loan portion to build a latrine. Phyroth would be so satisfied that, via the help of the requested loan portion, he can create a healthier environment in which his family can live as well as avoid using unsanitary practices.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
.
to buy oil, salt, sugar, rice and beans.

loans.name: Lorena Cleotilde

texts.es: Lorena Cleotilde tiene 46 años de edad, casada con  cuatro hijos de 21, 24,25 y 27 años de edad todos ellos trabajan excepto uno que es discapacitado, ella tiene una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio al igual ella tiene un puesto de enabas al igual que le deja ingresos donde puede invertir más en su pulpería, Lorena tiene varios años de experiencia y sabe las necesidades de sus clientes. Negocio que poco a poco y  con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir  adelante. Lorena está solicitando financiamiento para el negocio para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos entre otros productos que más demandan, ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas que le han bridando apoyo para tener un medio de trabajo digno de ellos.
texts.en: Lorena Cleotilde is 46 years old. She is married and has four children, aged 21, 24, 25 and 27 years old. All of them work except for one who is disabled.  She has a store located in her home as well as an ENABAS locale [National Business of Basic Food] which also brings in income that she can invest into her store. Lorena has several years' experience and she knows what her customers need. She has made her business get ahead little by little with a lot of hard work. Lorena is asking for her business to buy snacks, basic grains, and other products that are the most in demand. She is very grateful to the investors that have offered there support to have a way to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy and sell edible products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, salt, boxes of matches, cigarettes, juices, sodas, snacks, and ice cream products.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Victoria De David Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal La Victoria de David, está conformada por 8 integrantes, de los cuales 7 son mujeres, y un hombre. Son originarios del Sauce, todos padres de familias con hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas personas han demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en los créditos anteriores pagando sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico están personas han tenido que trabajar duro casi toda su vida para salir adelante  con sus familias. 
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelantes, Dania Maricela es la coordinadora del banco y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde se vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, detergente, jabón. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles. El banco comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank, David's Victory, is made up of 8 members, of which 7 are women and there is also a man. They are from Sauce and all parents of families with children in their care. These people have demonstrated their payment responsibility with prior loans, making their payments in a timely manner. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources they are people that have had to work hard almost all of their lives in order to move forward with their families.
Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and desire to move forward, Dania Maricela is the coordinator of the bank and has for a living a convenience store located in her home. Her store is a small store that sells products in small quantities like coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, detergent and soap. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital to stock her business in the purchase and sale of products. The communal bank is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to people of little resources and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock their store with products such as coffee, shampoo, tomato sauce, rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Alberto Mauricio

texts.es:
Alberto, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la temporada agrícola, este dinero será utilizado para comprarse los materiales agrícolas como abono, herbicidas, también pagara el alquiler de tres manzanas de terreno.

Con el préstamo anterior logro aumenta el cultivo, el cual utiliza para el consumo en su familia y para la venta, esto le ha dado mejoras a su estabilidad familiar, seguir trabajando a través de estos préstamos.
texts.en:
Alberto decided to take out a new loan to be able to invest in the farming season. This money will be used to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer and herbicides as well as to pay for renting three manzanas [5.178 acres] of land. 

With the previous loan he was able to increase his crop for family consumption. This has improved the family stability and keep working through these loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides and to pay for renting three manzanas [5.178 acres]  of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to lease land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario denominado Mujeres Emprendedoras, es un grupo conformado por tres mujeres valientes, dignas de admiración y que luchan día a día por sacar adelante a cada una de sus familias.
La presidenta de este grupo es la Sra. María, una mujer que se define como una persona humilde, honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora, María tiene 32 años, ella vive junto a sus 3 hijos y su esposo en la ciudad de Latacunga, María se dedica a la venta de helados de paila por las calles de la ciudad, siendo un negocio sacrificado pero que María lo hace con mucho amor, para poder ayudar en la economía de su hogar.
María solicito un crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra de un congelador para preservar la calidad y el sabor de los helados que vende, María sabe que esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y por ende los ingresos serán mejores.
El sueño que María tiene es seguir creciendo con su negocio, tener un local propio donde vender sus helados y seguirles apoyando a sus hijos y darles la educación que es lo más importante para que logren ser unas personas de bien.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) and it’s composed of three brave women who are worthy of admiration who strive daily to move each of their families forward.  The group president is María, a woman who defines herself as humble, honest, responsible and very hardworking.  María is 32-year-old and lives with her three children and husband in the city of Latacunga.

María sells fruit sorbets throughout the city streets; it’s demanding work that María does with much love in order to help her household economy.  María asked FODEMI for a loan to buy a freezer to maintain the quality and flavor of the sorbets she sells.  María knows that this investment will help her increase business and her income will be improved as a result too.  María’s dream is to continue growing with her business, to have her own sorbet shop and to continue supporting her children and give them education which is the most important thing for them to become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Emma, 33, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Richard, a truck driver and she is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Emma operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emma hopes to expand her business and dreams to have their own house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
La señora Julieta tiene un hijo, vive en anticrético ocupando una habitación con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, también cuenta con una cocina, baño, comedor y sala, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Escobar Uria de la ciudad de La Paz.

Julieta trabaja de forma independiente realizando trámites por más de ocho horas al día, ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de agua, luz, alquiler y alimentación de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una fotocopiadora ya que es muy necesario en el trabajo que ella realiza. De esta forma ahorrará en este gasto que es un costo muy importante en su negocio. 

El sueño de Julieta es mejorar sus ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Julieta has one child, and she lives in a house under the “anticrético” mode [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you].  She occupies one room with fine finishing touches and a wood floor.  She also has a kitchen, bathroom, dining room, and living room.  The house is located in the Escobar Uria area of the city of La Paz.

Julieta works in an independent way processing paperwork for over eight hours a day.  She does this because she is the only one who covers the expenses for water, electricity, rent, and food for her family.

She needs the loan to buy a photocopier, which is much needed in the work she does.  This way she will save this expense, which is an important cost in her business.

Julieta’s dream is to improve her income in order to improve her quality of life.  This is the first time with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier for her business of processing documents.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Don José es una persona emprendedora, José tiene 34 años de edad es casado y tiene dos hijos viven en la parroquia de Pelileo cerca de la ciudad de Ambato, José se define como una persona de carácter amable, trabajador, alegre, solidario y emprendedor, José se dedica hace más de 10 años a la carpintería fabricando muebles como camas, comedores, armarios, negocio que le va bien y le ayuda a sacar adelante a su familia.
El crédito que José solicita a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de madera para la fabricación de mueble como comedores, camas, armarios, veladores y en la adecuación del taller de carpintería con la compra de herramientas, inversión que le ayudara a obtener mejores ingresos para su hogar.
Don José sueña con lograr terminar su casa para vivir junto a su esposa y sus hijos, y tener un taller de carpintería más grande donde pueda dar trabajo a los jóvenes de su comunidad.
texts.en:
José is an enterprising person. He is 34 years old, married, and has two children. They live in the parish of Pelileo, near the city of Ambato. José describes himself as a friendly person; hard-working, cheerful, supportive, and enterprising.

José has been a carpenter for more than 10 years, making furniture such as beds, dining tables, and cabinets. His business is going well and is helping him raise his family.

The loan that José is applying to FODEMI for will be used to buy wood for making furniture, such as dining tables, beds, cabinets and pedestal tables, and for equipping his carpentry workshop through the purchase of tools. This investment will help him earn better income for his household.

José dreams of finishing his home, where he can live with his wife and children, and have a larger carpentry workshop where he can provide work to the young people of his community.

loans.use: To buy wood and equip his carpentry shop through the purchase of tools.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia ocupando solo dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa San Juan  en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de doce horas tejiendo canastillas para las florerías, ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital y comprar el material mimbre utilizado en la elaboración de sus canastillas ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de María, es construir su casa para tener más comodidad y seguridad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: María is single and has no children.  She lives in her own, two-room house with brick walls and dirt floor located in the city of La Paz’s Villa San Juan zone.  She currently works more than 12 hours daily weaving baskets for flower shops because she must use what little she earns to cover basic food and utility costs.  She needs the loan to increase capital to buy wicker used to make the baskets because she wants to increase her income and quality of life.  María’s dream is to build her house to have more comfort and security.  This is her first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy wicker used to make baskets for flower shops.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Doña Gladis es una persona, llena de virtudes como el amor y el trabajo honesto y responsable, Gladis vive en la ciudad de Ambato, vive junto a su esposo, ella se describe como una mujer humilde, solidaria y muy trabajadora, Gladis se dedica en la fabricación y la venta de calzado industrial hace más de 20 años, este trabajo a la señora Gladis le ha dado grandes satisfacciones como el criar y dar la educación a sus hijos.
El crédito que q Gladis solicita a FODEMI es para invertir en la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de calzado y la posterior venta a los principales almacenes de la ciudad. Esta inversión ayudara a la señora Gladis a mejorar a oferta de sus productos y ofrecer un producto de calidad y cubrir la demanda que actualmente tiene.
El sueño que Gladis tiene es seguir trabajando y ser una de las principales distribuidoras de calzado industrial en todo el país y seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Gladis is a person of many virtues such as love, honest work, and responsibility. She lives in the city of Ambato together with her husband. She describes herself as a humble, caring, and hardworking woman. Gladis has been manufacturing and selling industrial footwear for over 20 years. This work has given Gladis great satisfaction such as raising her children and providing them with an education. The loan that Gladis is requesting from FODEMI is for the purchase of raw materials for footwear manufacturing and its subsequent sale to the city's main storehouses. This loan will help Gladir to improve her supply, to offer quality products, and to meet the current demand. 

Gladis' dreams are to continue working, to be one of the main industrial footwear distributors in the entire country, and to continue financially supporting her family to cover household needs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather for footwear manufacturing.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es: Marjorie es una mujer joven de 33 años de edad, divorciada y madre de cuatro niños. Actualmente vive en unión libre con el padre de dos de sus hijos. Ella es muy trabajadora y tiene visión empresarial. Se dedica a su negocio sin descuidar a su familia. Siempre ha invertido en el comercio ambulante y por su forma de ser le ha ido muy bien, cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y hermanas cuando tiene que salir a vender o cobrar su mercadería. Ahora va invertir en una nueva actividad, ella va a comprar dos cabezas de ganado, para que le genere más ingresos y asi ir mejorando la calidad de vida. Cuenta con el apoyo de una hermana para el cuido de sus animales.
texts.en: Marjorie, 33, is a young, divorced woman mother of four children.  She currently lives in a free union with the father of two of her children.  She’s very hardworking and has an enterprising spirit.  She works in her business without neglecting her family.  She’s always invested in street commerce and has done well because of the way she is.  Her mother and sisters help out when she has to go out to sell or collect payment for her merchandise.  Now, she’s going to invest in a new activity.  She will buy two heads of cattle to generate more income and gradually improve quality of life.  A sister will help her care for her animals.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle.

loans.name: Las Cumplidoras Group

texts.en:
Nine entrepreneurial women make up Las Cumplidoras Trust Bank. They are neighbors and friends from Olintepeque City, a 20-minute drive from Quetzaltenango in western Guatemala. Since the group was formed a few years ago, these ingenious women have expanded their businesses and increased their income, which has allowed them to support their families in ways they formerly thought impossible.  

As a new member of the group, Eva Maria, is starting her first loan cycle. She is 20 years old and a mother of two boys (a three year-old toddler and a five month-old baby). Both Eva Maria and her husband work to earn money for their family. Her husband is a toy merchant and Eva Maria raises pigs. She currently owns four pigs, but has plans to double that number with the loan she obtained from her involvement in the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank. The increased income will further Eva Maria’s dream of going back to school. Her formal education was interrupted with the birth of her first son when she was in 8th grade, but she is excited about the non-formal education that Friendship Bridge provides with the loans. In the meantime, the money she earns will help ensure her own children complete school.

Along with Eva Maria, the ladies of Las Cumplidoras Trust Bank are engaged in various enterprises including sewing, the sale of chickens, fruit, food, and traditional clothing; and the management of a convenience store. On average these women have four children, each of whom they hope to provide a good education and continued good health. These important goals are now in reach because of the monthly training they receive from Friendship Bridge along with their loans. Lessons cover topics such as self-esteem, children's rights, business management, money management, budgeting, and savings.

loans.use: to buy four pigs.

loans.name: Moisesina

texts.en:
Moisesina is 55 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Moisesina has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Moisesina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 27 years old and married with two children. For the past three years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Mary Jane also earns an income from selling fruit. She has borrowed and repaid four previous loans through NWTF and works hard to provide for her family.

Mary Jane is requesting an 13,000 PHP loan to buy items to sell such as canned goods, spices, soft drinks, soap, and other products. In the future, she aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, soft drinks, soap, and other products

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela es una joven de 22 años de edad, la cual vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad con un clima variado y en el cual se encuentran playas hermosas y una gastronomía muy variada. Pamela es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tal es así que ella estudia la carrera de Ciencias de la comunicación y para poder solventar sus estudios trabaja como asistente en una institución de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y por las noches acude a su centro de estudios; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Pamela está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería como bermudas, bivirís, polos, faldas, entre otros ya que para ofrecer estos productos a sus compañeros de clase y de trabajo, con lo cual podrá tener un ingreso extra, así como también poder pagar su matrícula para la universidad. Así ella podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Trabajar en una gran empresa de periodismo del país”.
texts.en:
Pamela, 22, is a young woman living in the city of Chincha, a city with a variable climate that has beautiful beaches and a very diverse cuisine.  Pamela is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead, so much so that she’s studying Communication Science and to pay for her education works as an assistant in an institution in the city.  She works about 8 hours daily and attends classes at night.  She believes that she’s doing well because she’s responsible and above all because she has a strong drive to get ahead.

Pamela is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will buy merchandise like Bermuda shorts, BVDs, shirts, skirts, etc. to sell to her classmates and coworkers.  She will earn extra income this way and will also be able to pay her university tuition and will be able to continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to work for one of the country’s great journalism firms.

loans.use: to pay tuition and to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosita is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosita has been farming rice for 11 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
