Lucy lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living by providing transportation services. She has been doing this for five years so as to support the needs of her four children. She earns an income of PHP 2,000 a month from this business. For a 34-year-old mother, there is nothing that can make her more happy than to see her children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Lucy is borrowing an amount of PHP 3,000 from GDMPC microcredit to repair her transport vehicle that she uses in her business and to provide her children a better education. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Karanjung Indah Group

texts.en:
To increase further their businesses, The Karanjung Indah group is borrowing another loan from MUK, with the increasing loan size. They feel comfortable to take the loan, because they also have been trained by the MUK staff.
 
After successfully repaying the previous loan, Ni Komang continues in the program and borrows a loan, to purchase superior feed and renovate the animals' cage. Ni Komang has a plan to increase the quality of her pigs, by giving them a nutritious feed and vitamins. She hopes she can earn more profit this way. She hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: To purchase superior feed and renovate her animals' cage

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 69 years old. She is widowed and has four children. 

To make a living, Peregrina owns and operates a tailoring business, tailoring and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Peregrina has been in her business for 28 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Peregrina joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Gayatri Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2010, ten women came together and formed the Gayatri Self Help Group to save money and help those are facing problem in the group. Sabita is the group member selected as the leader of Gayatri Self Help Group. The lady standing in the third position from the right side of the photograph and wearing a light orange color saree is Sabita. 

Sabita is married and has one son. She is 30 years old and stays with her son and her husband. 

Sabita has applied for a loan for paddy cultivation. She is very talented and has been operating her business for the past six years. With the loan investment, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay the labor charges that will allow her to do her work more efficiently. Her husband is also helping her in the paddy cultivation. 

Sabita started her business six years ago because it is difficult for her husband to manage the household expenses in addition to paying for the son's education. Her son is enrolled in local schools and getting education. She is confident that her son will be able to continue  his education and become successful in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and hybrid seed, and pay the labor charges.

loans.name: Yensi

texts.es:
Yensi es una mujer joven, que formó parte de un banco mujer, pero toma la decisión de retirarse.Ella vive con su compañero y su hijo un bebé de 6 meses.Vive en una comunidad rural, carente de fuentes de trabajo asalariadas . Para contribuir a los gastos de su casa ella vende ropa, cosméticos y otros artículos en forma ambulante , casa por casa en su barrio y lugares cercanos.Ella todos los días vende  y cobra cada ocho días los sábados.
La falta de dinero  por recuperaciones lentas en algunos meses del año ,hace que ella no pueda cubrir todos los pedidos de sus clientes.Por eso ella solicita apoyo económico , mediante un crédito , para solventar este obstáculo.Ya que tiene como meta consolidar su negocio,incrementar sus ingresos para poder mejores sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yensi is a young woman who was previously member of a communal bank, but decided to leave the group. She lives with her partner and their six-month-old baby. She lives in a rural community where salaried work sources are scarce. To contribute towards the household expenses, she sells clothes, cosmetics, and other items door-to-door in her neighborhood and nearby places. 

She goes out to sell every day and picks up payments every Saturday. Lack of money due to months when customers take time to pay means that she cannot meet all the orders that her customers make. This is why she is requesting financial support in the form of a loan to overcome this obstacle. Her goal is to strengthen her business and increase her profits in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, and other personal care items to sell.

loans.name: Mani Nageswari Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2009 a group of nine women came together from a small village in Odisha and formed Mani Nageswari SHG. Puspanjali was selected as the leader of Mani Nageswari SHG. The lady sitting in the second position from right side of the photograph is Puspanjali.

Puspanjali is 32 years old, married, and living with her husband, one daughter and one son. She has been involved in a milk business for two years. She has one cow and she wants to purchase one more cow because the demand for milk is high and she is not able to supply the growing demand of the customers in the market.

She has applied  for a loan to purchase a cow and fodder and also wants to repair her cattle shed. This business will help her to support her children's education. She says that this loan can help to increase her income, which will help her to purchase the study materials for her children's education and to pay her children's tuition fee.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder for her milk business.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa, a 26-year-old single man, lives in Al-Hodeida, Yemen. He is a member of one of the limited income households in Al-Hodeida. He just finished elementary school because he has had to work to help his family. He worked in different jobs to make his living. 

Mustafa rented a motorcycle two years ago and started working as a transporter. This business was profitable, but he earned little because most of the money went to the motorcycle's owner; therefore, he decided to buy his own motorcycle. He has applied for a youth loan in the amount of 100,000 YER to pay for a motorcycle. Mustafa hopes to improve his living conditions and buy a bus in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
Хафиза обратилась в МДО «Арванд» для получения кредита, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.  Она содержит дома несколько голов скота. Эта основная ее работа, в их регионе откорм скота и выращивание сельскохозяйственных культур являются очень актуальными, поэтому она  в серьез занимается этим делом, чтобы прокормить свою семью.  У нее большая семья и работа в кишлаке хватает но не на всех, многие уезжают в Россию на заработки, но Хафиза не хочет отправлять свою семью в чужую страну и старается сама их прокормить.  Для этого она хочет получить кредит в Арванде чтобы купить несколько голов скота  и продолжить развивать свой бизнес. Хафиза очень благодарна
организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Hafiza turned to MDO "Arvand" to receive a loan to increase her livestock count.  She keeps several heads of livestock at home.  This is her main job; in their region raising livestock and growing crops is very realistic, and this is why she takes this business seriously in order to feed her family.  She has a big family and there is not enough work for everyone in the village, many travel to Russia to earn money, but Hafiza does not want to send her family to a foreign country and tries to feed them herself.  This is why she would like to get a loan from Arvand to buy several heads of livestock and to continue to grow her business.  Hafiza is very grateful to Arvand for the financial support and help.

loans.use: to  purchase cattle

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарине 36 лет, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. Все дети Зарины маленькие самой старшему 12 лет. Все учатся в школе. В свободное от школы время дети помогают матери. Зарина является преподавателем русского языка и литературы в местной школе. По характеру очень добрая и веселая девушка. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Зарина занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имея в хозяйстве развитое хозяйство, Зарина имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарина обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и семена,удобрения для посадки. Доходы Зарина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Zarina is 36 years old, is married and is raising 5 children.  All of Zarina's children are young, the oldest is 12.  All of them go to school.  In their free time the children help their mother.  Zarina teaches Russian language and literature at the local school.  She has a very kind and happy personality.  As a source of income for her family, Zarina farms and raises livestock.  Having a developed farm, Zarina has a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Zarina turned to "Bai-Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a milk cow and seeds and fertilizer for planting.  Zarina plans to invest her earnings into growing her farm further.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Utkurbek

texts.ru:
Уткурбек молодой мужчина 26 лет, он женат и имеет двоих детей.  Так как у него нет образования и не учился в свое время он занимается откармливанием скота.  Он с самого детство чувствовал финансовые проблемы в своей семье и знал,что учиться не получится.  Отец  Уткурбека научил его откармливать скот и с юности он занимался этим видом деятельности. Уткурбек знает все преимущества этого бизнеса. 
Он давно не ремонтировал свой дом и живет в плохих условиях, поэтому хочет накопить денег и отремонтировать свой дом.  Для этого он планирует  купить скот и расширить свой бизнес.
Уткурбек надеется на  финансовую поддержку от организацию  Кива и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Utkurbek is a 26-year old man, married, with two children. Since he has no college degree and   didn’t pursue his studies when he was younger, he raises livestock. From his childhood on, he was aware of the financial difficulties in his family and knew he wouldn’t be able to get a degree. Utkurbek’s father taught him how to raise livestock, and this is the work Utkurbek has been engaged in from a young age. Utkurbek knows all the advantages of this business.

He has not renovated his house for a long time, and his living conditions are poor, which is why he would like to save up for house renovations. In order to do this, he plans to buy livestock and expand his business. Utkurbek hopes for financial support from Kiva and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy  cattle.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a 41-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has two grown children. She has a RTW (Ready to Wear) business. She sells shorts, blouses, pants and shirts. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Jinky requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more RTW pants, shirts, blouses and shorts to meet the needs of her customers. In the future, Jinky would like to expand her business to support her family and have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more RTW (Ready to Wear) pants, shirts, blouses and shorts

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. They live in San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. Ma. Lourdes has been in a rice farming business for more than seven years now. She also has a food vending venture. Her husband works as a farmer.

Ma. Lourdes does her best to earn a living so that she can support the needs of the family. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Also, she wants to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, Ma. Lourdes hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Jinny Mae

texts.en:
Jinny Mae is a 21-year-old married woman with three young children. The oldest child is 3 while the youngest is 1 month old. She operates a vulcanizing shop business. Aside from the vulcanizing business, she grows rice. She has been growing rice for five years.

Jinny Mae requested a loan to buy fertilizers, rice seedlings and groceries. In the future, Jinny Mae would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seedlings and groceries

loans.name: Fedor

texts.ru:
Федор - предприниматель из г. Каменка-Днепровская. Он выращивает овощи в теплицах, а также выполняет сварочные работы. В прошлом году Федор использовал КИВА кредит для пленки и семян. Федор получил хороший урожай. Также было много заказов по сварочным работам благодаря чему Федор смог получить дополнительный доход. Произведя подсчеты в конце сезона, Федор увидел, что доход со сварочных работ был большим, а доход с теплицы - меньше ожидаемого.

В этом году Федор просит предоставить ему кредит на ремонт своих теплиц, покупку семян и топлива для отопления. Он изменить конструкцию теплицы (сделать ее более морозоустойчивой), чтобы получть урожай как можно раньше, и таким образом увеличить доход.

В семье Федора есть небольшие изменения - сразу две его дочери пошли в школу в первый класс. Теперь Федор с женой помогаю им делать домашнее задание.
texts.en:
Fedor is an entrepreneur from Kamenka-Dneprovskaya.  He grows vegetables in greenhouses and also performs welding jobs. Last year he used his loan received from Kiva to buy plastic sheeting and seeds.  Fedor had a good harvest.  In addition, he received a lot of orders for welding jobs, which allowed him to make some additional income. At the end of the season Fedor did some calculations and saw that income from welding was higher, but income from his greenhouse - less than expected. 

This year, Fedor is requesting a loan to repair his greenhouses, as well as to buy seeds and fuel for heating.  He plans to redesign a greenhouse (making it more frost-resistant), so that he will be able to harvest earlier and, as a result, to increase his income.

There has been a minor change in Fedor's family situation: his two daughters have entered first grade.  Fedor and his wife now help them with their homework.

loans.use: to fix his greenhouses, and to buy some seeds and fuel for heating.

loans.name: Satymkan

texts.ru: Сатымкан 49 лет, замужем,мать 5 детей. Сыновья Сатымкан взрослые, дети помогают ей в ведении хозяйства. За период оформления кредита Сатымкан показала себя как человек ответственные, порядочный, добросовестный, предприимчивый и с чувством долга умеющий правильно вести и вкладывать денежные средства в нужное направление. Сатымкан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1983 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 500 рублей. Благодаря упорному труду Сатымкан, ее деятельность приносит около 17,000 KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Сатымкан имеет очень развитое хозяйство, в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 1 нетели, 20 овец и 5 ягнят. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сатымкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Сатымкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Satymkan is 49 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  Her sons are adults now, and her children help her run the farming business.  

During the loan processing period, Satymkan appeared as a responsible, honest, conscientious and enterprising person with a sense of duty.  She also appeared as a good money manager and wise investor.

Satymkan has been involved in animal husbandry since 1983, and this activity is the family's main source of income.  She started in this business with an initial capital of 500 rubles.  Thanks to her hard work, she now makes close to 17,000 som (KGS) per month, which is essentially used to cover the family's food expenses and daily living costs.

Satymkan's farming business is doing well: she currently owns four cows, one heifer, 20 sheep and five lambs.

In order to further increase her business, Satymkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 45,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some sheep.  She plans to use the revenues from her loan to further invest in the expansion of her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Mr. Gansuh is 33 years old and lives alone in Ger in Bulgan Province of Mongolia. His parents live in the countryside breeding their livestock. This borrower has a hearing disability and graduated from a special training school. He used to live with his parents in the countryside and has just moved to the province's center. He is now planning to start his own cobbler service business at home. 

Mr.Gansuh is now requesting 500,000 tugriks to purchase inventory and tools to start his own cobbler service business at home. He is a hardworking, kind and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and tools to start his own cobbler service at home

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en: Ma. Chona is 29 years old and is married. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. Ma. Chona is engaged in a rice farming business and gasoline retailing venture. Her husband works on the farm as well. Ma. Chona needs a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and additional gasoline to sell in her store. In the future, Ma. Chona hopes to improve their business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and additional gasoline to sell in her store

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepcion

texts.es: Ramona del socorro a sus 68 años de edad soltera con dos hijos mayores de edad de 32 y35 ambos independientes es una mujer luchadora que ha cumplido uno de sus deseos de ser independiente teniendo su propio negocio, para ella este negocio ha sido muy importante, logrando salir adelante y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos, no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento para su negocio, Con el crédito anterior ha aumentado su mercadería y sus clientes por los productos que les ofrece. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos ya que tiene varios encargos de parte de sus clientes, con el crédito comprara lápiz labial, perfumes, cremas, pinturas entre otras productos.
texts.en: Ramona del Socorro, 68, is single and has two adult children who are 32 and 35 years old; both are independent.  She’s a hardworking woman who accomplished one of her wishes to be an independent business owner.  For her, this business has been very important in that she’s succeeded in moving ahead and in providing a good education for her children.  This isn't the first time she’s requested financing for her business.  She used her previous loan to increase her stock merchandise and the number of her customers thanks to the products she offers.  She’s currently requesting a new loan to buy more products since she has several pending customer orders.  She will use the loan to buy lipstick, perfume, cream and make-up, among other products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Vergilia

texts.en: Vergilia is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. They live in Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. Vergilia has been in a farming and hog raising business for more than 12 years now. These are the sources of her income. Vergilia is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her farm. Also, she can improve her income; thus, allowing her to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of dishes and home products.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a 47-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest child is 28 while the youngest is 5. She has a fish vending business. Her husband is a fisherman. Aside from the fish vending business, she operates a sari-sari (variety store) business. She sells commodities like biscuits, noodles, soaps and soft drinks. Due to financial problems, Josefina requested a loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings and beverages. In the future, Josefina would like to expand her business to support her family and save for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings and beverages

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван – из Виноградово. Он торгует одеждой секонд хенд на одном из местных рынков.
Торговую точку арендует, наемных работников нет. Работает в этой сфере 1 год. До этого работал на заводе. Но потом потерял работу, было финансово очень трудно. Иван был вынужден пойти на рынок торговать.  
Иван хочет докупить партию детских колготок и носочков на 10 000 гривен, чтобы расширить торговлю и пополнить ассортимент товара. Полученную прибыль Иван надеется использовать для развития бизнеса и улучшения быта семьи.
texts.en:
Ivan is from Vinogradovo.  He sells second-hand clothes at one of the local markets.  He rents his retail space and has no employee.  He has been working in this field for one year.  Previously, he used to work in a factory, but he lost his job, which put him in a very difficult financial situation and forced him to get a job as a market vendor.

In order to increase his commercial activity and boost his inventory, Ivan wants to buy an assortment of children's tights and socks for a sum of 10,000 hryvnia.  He would like to use his profits to develop his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of children's tights and socks.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 35 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Analie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, rice, etc in her general store business.

Analie has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Analie would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, rice, etc

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 53-year-old married woman living in Bien Unido, Bohol. Viola works with her husband in their fishing business. They have been in this type of venture for almost eight years now.

Viola hopes to make their business grow but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this loan, they will be able to improve their fishing business, thus augmenting their income and profit. The loan will be used to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. Furthermore, Viola hopes to repay her loan on time so that she can take another set of loans for the development of the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella works hard to support her family. Bella is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Bella requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned good, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Bella has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Bella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned good, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Chantsaldulam

texts.en: Mrs Chantsaldulam is 56 years old and lives with her husband in a small house in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband, Boldsaihan, works as a guardsman in a private local company. The borrower has been working as a chef in a local cafe from 1968 to 1991. She started her own small cafe at a local market in 1991. She has built a close relationship with her customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum windows and insulation material for the newly built extension part of her house. She is a hardworking and open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum windows and insulation material

loans.name: Lustria

texts.en:
Lustria works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a livestock-raising business in the Philippines.

Lustria requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Lustria is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamps.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 39 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to increase her stock of items to sell like soap, spices, noodles, egg, shampoo, etc.

Cecilia has been in this business for five years.

In the future Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to increase her stock of items to sell such as soap, spices, noodles, eggs, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Mrs. Lhagvasuren is 55 years old and lives with her husband and son in a house in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband, Nyamganjav, is helping his wife to run their farming business. Her son Hurelbat, age 20, is a sophomore engineering student at a university. They have been breeding cattle for 26 years and have been selling organic meat products and organs of cattle to local customers for a few years. The borrower is now requesting 3,900,000 MNT to purchase forage for their cattle to feed them during the winter and spring. The borrower and her husband are hardworking and modest people.

loans.use: to purchase forage for their cattle

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 52 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Judith has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the repair of her motorcycle transport.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the repair of her motorcycle transport

loans.name: Mricon

texts.en:
Mricon is 50 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Mricon works very hard to provide for them.

Mricon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of soft drinks, biscuits, and other groceries needed for her business.

Mricon has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Mricon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks, biscuits, and other groceries needed for her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support four children. She is married and has a buy and sell flowers business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Mary Ann is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a single woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store in the community. She sells commodities like beverages, noodles, soaps, and seasonings. She has been in the sari-sari business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy commodities like sugar, coffee, canned goods, noodles, soaps, and soft drinks to cater to the needs of her customers. Josefina would like to expand her business so that she can support her nephews as they pursue their education and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, canned goods, noodles, soaps, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Tumenhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Tumenhuu is 55 years old and lives with his wife in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Ser-Od, is retired and stays home. Tumenhuu had been working at a state-owned company for years and retired a few years ago. His and his wife's pensions cannot cover their family expenses, so he is planning to start his own business of meat products production and sales in a local market. 

He is now requesting 500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase livestock intestines and produce traditional food products to sell to local customers in a local market. He is a hardworking, neat and welcoming man.

loans.use: to purchase livestock intestines and produce traditional food products to sell to local customers in a local market.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nilda requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, canned goods, coffee, milk, and spices to sell.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Nilda successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to continue to build her general store.

In the future, Nilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items like soap, canned goods, coffee, milk, and spices to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nimfa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Nimfa is borrowing 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Nimfa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her motorcycle transport business.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita is a 49-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a mother of five children. Her oldest child is 27 years old while the youngest is 15 years old. She operates a retail business. Julita buys and sells herbal medicines. Her customers are members of her community. Julita requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more herbal medicines. Julita would like to invest in other ventures, support her family, and save for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more herbal medicines

loans.name: Jurelyn

texts.en: Jurelyn is a 32-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has 2 children. The oldest child is 7 while the youngest is 5. She engages in hog raising. Aside from hog raising, she grows rice. She has been growing rice for 10 years. She earns 10,000 PHP a month by doing both businesses. Jurelyn requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and rice seedlings to have an abundant harvest. In the future, Jurelyn would like to expand her business to support her family at the same time save for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support 6 children. She is married and has a sells flowers in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.
Rosalinda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. Shirley is married and has a restaurant in the Philippines.

Shirley requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Shirley has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ankhzaya

texts.en: Mrs. Ankhzaya, 28 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She and her husband have operated a printing business for the last five years.  The business has been stabilized and attracted quite a number of customers. She is requesting a loan of 4500000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. As a result, the automobile she is purchasing will be used for transportation purposes of printing materials. Ankhzaya has gotten a loan from our organization before and paid it back on the established schedule. She is one of our most reliable and trustworthy clients. Most importantly the automobile which runs on natural gas emits less exhaust thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas to transport printing orders.

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en: Mr. Myagmar, 50 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. His older daughter lives separately from her parents and has an infant child. His wife stays at home and looks after her daughter’s infant child. He himself has been working as an electrician at a private business entity since 2010. His second daughter goes to secondary high school. He is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase necessary construction materials and furniture. The construction materials will be used to cover the costs of repairing the outer shell of their house. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place since the renovated house won’t lose its heat easily. This will reduce the usage of coal and contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair the exterior of his home.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is 51 years old and married with 4 children.
Agustin works hard to provide for his family. He sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal.
Agustin has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been selling charcoal for 13 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transportation.
Agustin aspires to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Delailah

texts.en: Delailah's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice. She is 62 years old, married and has 2 children. She is from Curvada, Tukuran and been 43 years in farming, earning an amount of 8,000 PHP a month. Recently, Delailah joined GDMPC. Delailah is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for rice farming.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Betty is 34 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Betty has a restaurant in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

Betty has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Betty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Jeanne runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Jeanne has run her business for 10 years and earns 8,000 PHP per month from these activities. Jeanne is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She joined Kiva partner GDMPC in 2012. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 60 years old. Nenita is married and has one child. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a fish selling business. Nenita has been in this business for 42 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month from this activity. In 2009, Nenita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 36 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Tukuran, where she has earned a living for the last 10 years by selling home and used products. She makes PHP 4,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2008 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a widow with 6 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Tukuran. Elsa operates a fish vending business to earn a living. She's been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 9,950 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. In 2012 Elsa joined GDMPC. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda works hard to support her family. Emelda is married and sells fish in the Philippines.
Emelda requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.
Emelda has been in this business for 12 years now.
In the future, Emelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Shukirali

texts.ru:
Шукирали мужчина в возрасте 58 лет,он женат и имеет детей. Они  живут высоко в горах, где легко пасти скот. У него большой дом и хозяйство. Семья Шукрали  поддерживает его в развитии  хозяйства, они помогают выращивать арахис в сезонное время и разводить скот.   Каждые 5-6 месяцев Шукрали выводит готовых коров на рынок для продажи, а овец каждые  2 месяца.  Шукирали кроме откорма скота работает на стройке маляром. Но основной доход у него от откорма скота поэтому он старается развивать этот  бизнес.  В его отсутствии его дети и жена ухаживают за скотом. 
На полученный кредит  Шукирали планирует купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота.  Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Shukirali is a 58-year-old man who is married and has children. He and his family live high in the mountains, where it's easy to graze cattle. Shukirali has a large house and property. His family supports his efforts to develop his farming business and, during the summer seasons, helps to grow peanuts and take care of the livestock. Each 5-6 month, Shukirali takes his cows to the market for sale, while sheep are ready every 2 months. In addition to tending livestock, Shukirali works as a construction site painter. However, his livestock business represents his main source of income, which is why he strives to expand it. While he is away, his wife and children look after the animals.

Using this loan, Shukirali plans to purchase livestock and expand the size of his herd. He thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена – опытный бизнесмен в своей сфере деятельности. Она уже 15 лет торгует пряжей на одном из рынков своего родного города Мелитополя. У нее есть свое торговое место и круг постоянных доверяющих ей покупателей. 
Елена планирует закупить хорошую партию качественной пряжи на сумму в 10 000 гривен, полученную от КИВА и продолжать последовательно развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Elena is an experienced entrepreneur in her chosen occupation. For the past 15 years, she has been selling yarn at one of the markets in her home city of Melitopol. She has her own retail location and a group of regular clients who trust her. Elena plans to purchase a good lot of quality yarn worth 10,000 hryvnia she hopes to receive from Kiva, and to continue gradual development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new lot of quality yarn

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is a 31-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be good woman. She operates a retail store where she provides M-pesa services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delayed payments by customers. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her float for the M-pesa services. Her business goal is to run three more M-pesa outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she can improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to increase her float for M-pesa services.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 63-year-old married woman. She has 4 children that range in age from 30 to 43 years. She describes herself to be social and talkative woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, bread, margarine, cooking oil, etc. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for business expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household items to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she is able to improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy household items.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 43-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has 2 children. The oldest child is 15 while the youngest is 12. She has a fish vending business. Her husband is a fisherman. She sells fish, sea shells and shrimp. She has been in the fish vending business for 5 years. Virginia requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy an engine and a pump for their boat which will be very helpful for the daily fishing activities. In the future, Virginia would like to expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy an engine and a pump for their boat.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 7 children that range in age from 10 to 33 years. She describes herself to be social and talkative woman. She operates a retail business where she sells sandals. Her business is located in a local residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sandals to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she can educate her children with profits generated from the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more sandals to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 34 years old, married and has two children who are currently in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been raising pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.
In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Asteria successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

NWTF is re-listing Asteria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a 43-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from four to 23 years. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more cereal to sell. Her business goal is to run a bigger cereals retail store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children ranging in age from two to six years. She describes herself to be a quiet and humble woman. She operates a general store where she sells items such as cereals, onions, tomatoes, sweets, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy cereals, sweets, and vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business and employ people within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sweets, and vegetables to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Levisarah

texts.en: Levisarah is a 37-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has five children. The youngest child is eight, while the oldest is 17 years old. She is engaged in a buying and selling business. She buys and sells fish to customers in the community. She has been in the buy-and-sell business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fresh fish, salt, and foam to cater to the needs of her customers. In the future, Levisarah would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, salt, and foam.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Alejandra works hard to support her family. She has an Avon dealership business in the Philippines. Alejandra is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell to her customers. Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard  is a 31-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is eight years old. He describes himself to be a determined man. He operates a poultry business where he sells chickens. His business is located at a fast growing business area and his primary customers are residents from surrounding areas. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Bernard will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more chicks to sell. His business goal is to sell chickens wholesale within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after repaying successfully the previous loan of Kes 10,000.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is a married woman. She has two children, aged 10 years and 19 years old. She describes herself to be a determined woman. She operates a bookstore where she sells books. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a busy urban area and her primary customers are schools and residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for buying books. 

Eddah will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more books to sell. Her business goal is to open multiple bookstores  within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after taking out a loan of Kes 15,000 which she repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy books to sell

loans.name: Argeo

texts.en:
Argeo is 41 years old and has four children.  Argeo is married and has two children who are in school.

Argeo is in the agricultural business, farming fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Argeo requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

Argeo has been farming fruits and vegetables for twelve years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.

In the future, Argeo would like to save enough money to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 34 years old, married, and supports a family of five children aged between one year and 12 years. His spouse assists him in meeting some of their financial needs. Charles is a livestock trader and he has been in this business for the last six years.

Charles has borrowed a second loan of KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD after successfully paying for his first loan. He intends to use the whole amount of the loan to buy more goats and sheep for sale at a profit.

From this business he gets an average income of KES.32,000 a month. With the anticipated profits he intends to expand his business, and his future plan is to expand his business and venture into other businesses in order to diversify his sources of income.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep to sell at a profit.

loans.name: Valerian

texts.en:
Valerian is a 47-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 5 years to 23 years. He describes himself to be hard working. He operates a retail business where he sells kerosene and provides  battery recharging services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Valerian describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy kerosene to sell. His business goal is to be a wholesaler  within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy kerosene to sell

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария – предпринимательница из Мелитополя. Она занимается мелким рыночным предпринимательством, торгуя женским трикотажем на одном из крупных местных рынков. Мария работает в этой сфере торговли уже 14 лет. На данный момент она имеет собственное торговое место. Мария – разведена. 
Мария планирует использовать 10 000 гривен, полученных от КИВА, для закупки партии товара, а именно для приобретения футболок и белья под реализацию на своей торговой точке.
texts.en:
Mariya is a businesswoman from Melitopol. She is in a small item retail business selling women's undergarments on one of the biggest local markets. Mariya works in this field of sales for fourteen years. At this time she has her own vendor location. She is divorced.

Mariya plans to use the Kiva 10,000 hryvnia loan to stock up on merchandise, particularly to buy t-shirts and underwear to sell at her vendor location.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru:
Катерина уже два раза пользовалась кредитами КИВА. Предыдущие кредиты Катерина вкладывала в торговлю сладостями. Несмотря на все усилия, которые она прикладывала к тому, чтобы бизнес стабильно развивался и приносил постоянную прибыль, сладости часто портились вследствие того, что вся продукция не реализовывалась вовремя. Из-за этого Катерина несла определённые убытки. Поэтому она решила полностью поменять вид деятельности и занялась реализацией женской и детской одежды, за счёт чего стал увеличиваться и доход.  
В этот раз Катерина обратилась за суммой в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить женские свитера и детские курточки под реализацию в зимнее время года. Теперь Катерина не боится убытков, как раньше, и надеется, что сможет вкладывать больше средств в последующее развитие собственного бизнеса.
texts.en:
Katerina has been using Kiva's loans twice now. She invested the previous loans into selling of sweets. Even though she put a lot of effort to make her business grow and bring in regular profit the sweets frequently went bad because all of the goods were not sold in time. Because of that Katerina sustained some losses. This is why she decided to entirely change her business model and started to sell women's and children's clothing and by that has increased her income.

This time Katerina has come for a loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia to buy women's sweaters and children's jackets to sell during the winter season. Right now Katerina is not afraid of losses as before and hopes that she can invest more money into the continuous growth of her own business.

loans.use: to buy women's sweaters and children's jackets.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity  is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a faithful and independent woman. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents.
 
Charity describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bananas in large quantities to sell. Her business goal is to run a new grocery store  within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bananas in large quantities to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a lady of thirty-five years old, married to Charles and a mother of two children. She operates a spare parts shop in Kangemi and has been in this business for three years now. Mary gets a monthly income of KES. 50,000

This will be Mary's third loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy twenty tyres for resale. In future she wants to open another spare parts shop.

loans.use: To buy twenty new tyres for sale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling peanut butter in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients and empty bottles for her peanut butter making.

Carmelita has been in this business for 22 years. Carmelita earns more income from food vending.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and empty bottles for her peanut butter.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be humble, hard-working and a warm woman. She operates a repair service business where she repairs motor vehicles.  She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a potential business area and her primary customers are motor vehicle owners.

Catherine describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Lynsy

texts.en:
Lynsy is 32 years old and single.

Lynsy runs a business which buys and sells computer accessories in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more accessories to sell. Lynsy has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Lynsy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more accessories to sell

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 45 years old. She lives in the Senaki District with her husband and son. Ekaterine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up without success. Her loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The source of the family's income is agricultural activities. In particular they have three milk cows and four calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They also have a plot of agricultural land, where maize and 200 nut trees are grown. It hardly provides enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs in the subsistence poor category.

Ekaterine requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Ekaterine will trade used clothing. She plans to buy used clothing from the wholesalers and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to trade used clothing

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a self-driven and honest woman. She operates a general store where she sells vegetables, fruits and household items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the retail shop and grocery store. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy vegetables, fruits and household items. 

Her business goal is to start a new business - a boutique - within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business and own this boutique. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of 20,000 KES which she managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits and household items

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a 54-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has  ten children, five boys and five girls. The oldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 13 years old. She has been engaged in a food vending business for 30 years now. In her business, she sells cooked rice, vegetables and meat dishes. She earns 10,000 PHP per month. This is the source of her income.

Leonarda is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her business like vegetables, meat, seasonings and spices, as well as webbed chairs for the customers to sit in, and school supplies for her children who are currently studying. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy all the needs of her business and also her children.

In the future, Leonarda hopes to expand her business and become profitable. She wants her children to finish their schooling and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business like vegetables, meat, seasonings and spices, etc.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en: Santiago is a 55-year-old married man from San Miguel, Bohol. He has five children. The oldest child is 22 and the youngest is eight. He is a farmer and has grown rice for 18 years. Santiago earns 3,900 PHP a month through farming. Santiago requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy pesticide and fertilizers for a better harvest. In the future, Santiago would like to invest in other ventures to support his family including the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizers

loans.name: Koome

texts.en:
Koome  is a 30-year-old married man. He has a child who is one year old. He describes himself to be humble and a caring man. He operates a retail store  where he sells daily-use items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located within a convenient business area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for business expansion. 

Koome will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more daily-use items to sell. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy daily-use items

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a 63-year-old single woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like biscuits, condiments, beverages and noodles. Aside from her sari-sari (variety) store, she grows rice.She has been growing rice for 10 years. Lourdes requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and plant vitamins to have a bountiful harvest. In the future, Lourdes would like to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood and at the same time save for old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers  and plant vitamins

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is aged fifty-one and a farmer in Nkubu county where she lives with one child who is schooling. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past fifteen years producing tea, potatoes and fruit which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump that will help her in irrigating her crops for better yields.  That will help her earn extra income that will uplift her livelihood and help in paying for her child's schooling. She aspires to venture into dairy farming in the next five years.

Drought, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

Jane says Juhudi Kilimo is the best Micro finance institution for small-scale farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 53 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mercedes runs a business buying and selling charcoal and spices in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and spices to sell. Mercedes has been in this business for six years.

In the future Mercedes would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and spices to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old, married to Shadrack and supports a family of five members. She is a mixed crop farmer and has been in this business for the last three years. Her monthly income is 40,000 KES.

She is currently servicing her third loan from KADET LTD of 50,000 KES that will enable her to prepare the land and buy maize and potato seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. Three of her children are in school. Estela is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Estela would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Stella

texts.fr: Stella est une jeune femme de 31 ans avec à sa charge 02 enfants et femme au foyer.elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la place depuis près de 04 ans.elle sollicite un credit qui lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'activité.elle voudrait réinvestir les bénéfices qui résulteront de ce credit dans son activité et aussi mieux s'occuper des besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Stella is a young woman, 31 years old, and a homemaker who has two children to support. Nearly four years ago, she opened a hair salon in a local district. She is requesting a loan that will enable her to increase her level of business. She would like to reinvest into her business the profits resulting from this loan, and she would also like to do better in meeting the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants, les quatre femmes du groupe Tièssiri vivent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté. Elles font le  commerce de chaussures, sacs à main, pagnes wax et bazins. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 13ème  prêt solidaire.
Zenabou (femme en 2ème position  sur la photo de la  gauche  vers la droite) est connue à Darsalam et au marché Médine Ségou  pour la vente de chaussures de tous les âges.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 paires de chaussures au grand marché de Bamako. Elle revend en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Zenabou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité, assurer l’entretien et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households and on average 36 years old with three children, the four women of he Tièssiri group all live in the Darsalam area of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through familial relations. They run businesses selling shoes, handbags, pagnes wax (brightly printed West African clothing), and damask. With the goal of expanding their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 13th group (solidarity) loan.
Zenabou (the woman second from the left in the photo) is well-known in Darsalam and at the Médine Ségou market for her sales of shoes for all ages. She intends to use her loan to buy 40 pairs of shoes at the grand market in Bamako. She resells at retail in cash and on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women. With this loan, Zenabou hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and ensure the raising and education of her children.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory from Erlian, China to start up his wife's clothing retail business in the local market

loans.name: Jenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and from her general store. Jenaida is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Jenaida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her furniture business.

Jenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her furniture business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. She earns more income from raising pigs and fish vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Precela

texts.en:
Precela is a 34-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has 4 young children. The oldest child is 10 while the youngest is 2. She is engaged in farming. She grows rice. Her husband is also a farmer.

Aside from farming, Precela also operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells beverages, noodles and condiments. She has been operating the sari-sari store for 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase commodities to sell, like canned goods, noodles, sugar and soaps. In the future, she would like to expand her business to support her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase commodities like canned goods, noodles, sugar and soaps.

loans.name: Revelina

texts.en:
Revelina is a 62-year-old married woman with three grown children. She hails from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in a fish vending business: her husband is a fisherman and Revelina sells the fish to the community. Aside from fishing, she also engaged in farming; she grows rice and has done so for 21 years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month through farming. 

Revelina requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticide and rice seedlings. Revelina would like to invest in other ventures to support her family as well as to save for old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticide and rice seedlings

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a candlemaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years but earns more income from raising pigs. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional wax, oil and other materials for use in her candlemaking business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional wax, oil and other materials for use in her business

loans.name: Nellei

texts.en:
Nellei is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle-for-rent business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from a general store. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Nellei is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 36 years old. He is married with three children between one and twelve years old. Two of them go to school. He sells beans and owns a boutique. He has been in business for the past seven years. With the loans, he wants to buy more beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 38 years old. She is married with four children. She sells rice and beans. She wants the loan to buy more beans and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house for her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a supply of belts and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 50 years old and married with eight children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it. 

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert  is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be God-fearing , loving and a caring man. He operates a retail store  where he sells home-use products items such as sugar, tea leaves, maize flour, cooking fat, milk, rice, etc . He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located at a busy urban area and his primary customers are local consumers from the environs.

Gilbert describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of home-use products to meet the customers' high demand . He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more home-use products to sell. His business goal is to run another retail shop  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standard of his family. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. He managed to repay loans in the amount of Kes 20,000, 30,000 and 40,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy home-use products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is aged thirty-six and a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and two children. Only one child has started schooling. She has been in farming for the past seven years producing bananas, tobacco, maize, beans, vegetables and milk which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting 70,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase equipment for processing bio-gas which will help improve her living standards. She aspires to have bought one extra acre of land in the next five years.

Poor climatic conditions, inflation, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

She is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for enabling her to fight poverty.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for processing bio-gas

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Sally works hard to support her family. She has a trisikad (bicycle taxi) operator business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy paint and other materials for her trisikad operator business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. Sally hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy paint and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is married with four children. They all go to school except the youngest. She sells sorghum and beans, and she has been in the business for two years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. She plans to use the profits for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Pania

texts.en:
Pania is a 63-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is the mother of an 18-year-old son, and she is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 23 years. She earns about 1,000 PHP a month by doing the farming.

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticide for a better harvest. Pania would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to pay for her son's college education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide.

loans.name: Parwana's Group

texts.en:
Parwana is a 49-year-old Iraqi woman, the married mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Parwana is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Parwana has three years' experience with her small home-based sewing and tailoring business activity, which she would like to improve now by buying a pattern machine to enable her to offer a greater variety of creative services to her customers. To be able to make this purchase, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Parwana had a loan in the past. It was not a micro business loan but a personal one. She successfully repaid this loan before applying for the micro business loan. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a pattern sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 54-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has two children: a boy, 15, and a girl, 13, who are currently studying in school. She is  engaged in a piggery business and a rice farming business as well. She has operated her business for 33 years now and earns a living of 5,000 PHP per month. This is the source of her income and pays for her family's daily needs. Her husband is a farmer.

Nida is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings and feed. The fertilizer and rice seedlings will be used in rice farming and the feed is food for the pigs. Through this loan, she can accommodate the needs of her pigs and the farm. 

In the future, Nida hopes to expand her business and improve her family's life and her children's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings, and feed.

loans.name: Marie Chantal Lydie
